intro: Dryadella susanae, commonly known as the Mexican dryadella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Dryadella susanae thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
